column1: Tell me about the Witcher series
column2: The Witcher is a fantasy universe created by Polish Author Andrzej Sapkowski. However, the series is most popular for the games set in its universe.

column1: Tell me about the Witcher world
column2: The Withcer takes place on an unnamed planet that most of the characters refering to it as th World, the Earth or the Globe.

column1: Tell me about Geralt of Rivia
column2: Geralt of Rivia is a Witcher and the main protaganist of the Witcher series.

column1: Who is the main character in the Witcher
column2: Geralt of Rivia is the main character in the witcher
I'm here to talk to you about the Witcher. Specifically The Withcer 3: The Wild Hunt game. Ask my what ever you like and I'll try my best to answer it!

column1: describe define What is a Witcher
column2: A Witcher is a human that has undergone severe genetic mutations and rigerous training in a Witcher school. Most Witchers use there abilities and training to become monster hunters for hire.

column1: What does Geralt call his horse
Which Witcher school did Geralt go to
column2: Geralt was trained in the School of the Wolf at Kaer Morhen

column1: How many witcher schools are there
column2: There are 7 Witcher schools. School of the Bear, Cat, Crane, Griffin, Manticore, Viper and Wolf

column1: What mutations to Witchers go through
column2: The witcher trials are primarily a series of three grueling stages in the witcher training process. First comes The Choice, which involves dietary changes and grueling physical training. Young witchers are taught sword skill, monster lore and herbalism. The main trials are as follows:The Trial of the Grasses, which involved consuming various alchemical ingredients, or "the grasses" and affected the nervous system, The Trial of the Dreams, which involved the mutation of the eyes, bone marrow and hormones, allowed for better night vision, among other benefits. It also resulted in infertility. The Trial of the Mountains, The Trial of Forest Eyes, where they are blindfolded and tied up in the woods to find their way back to the camp

column1: Why do Witchers have two swords
column2: Witchers carry a Steel sword for humans and Beasts, and a Silver sword for monsters

column1: What powers do Witchers get from their mutations
column2: As a result of the mutations, Witchers benefit from  greater strength, speed, endurance, resilience, healing, senses, complete immunity to diseases and conventional poisons, and extreme resistance to pain.
